issues.title: Missing Charter Renewal Procedures
issues.description: California law requires specific procedures for charter renewal, including timelines for submission and review of renewal petitions. The policy mentions initial charter terms but lacks comprehensive renewal procedures required by Education Code 47607.

legal_citations.text: A charter may be renewed by the chartering authority for successive five-year terms. A charter school seeking renewal shall submit its petition for renewal no later than 30 days before the expiration of the charter, and the chartering authority shall rule on the renewal petition no later than 30 days before the expiration of the charter.

issues.required_language: Charter schools seeking renewal must submit renewal petitions no later than 30 days before charter expiration. The Board shall rule on renewal petitions no later than 30 days before charter expiration. Renewal may be granted for successive five-year terms based on the school's performance and compliance with charter terms.

issues.title: Missing Charter Revocation Procedures
issues.description: The policy lacks procedures for charter revocation, which is a critical oversight function required by Education Code 47607. This includes grounds for revocation and due process requirements.

legal_citations.text: A chartering authority may revoke a charter for material violation of the conditions, standards, or procedures set forth in the charter, including violations of generally accepted accounting principles or if the school has failed to meet or make sufficient progress toward the student outcomes identified in the charter.

issues.required_language: The Board may revoke a charter for material violations of charter conditions, standards, or procedures, including violations of generally accepted accounting principles, or failure to meet or make sufficient progress toward student outcomes. Revocation procedures shall include notice, opportunity for hearing, and written findings.

issues.title: Missing Oversight and Monitoring Procedures
issues.description: While the policy mentions accountability measures, it lacks specific ongoing oversight and monitoring procedures required for charter authorizers under Education Code 47604.32 and 47607.

legal_citations.text: A chartering authority shall monitor the fiscal condition of a charter school. A chartering authority may conduct program audits of a charter school during the term of the charter to ensure that the school is meeting the terms of its charter.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall establish procedures for ongoing monitoring of charter schools, including fiscal oversight, program audits, and review of annual reports. Monitoring shall ensure compliance with charter terms, applicable laws, and student outcome requirements.

issues.title: Missing Material Revision Procedures
issues.description: The documents lack procedures for handling material revisions to charter petitions, which are required under Education Code 47607 and are essential for ongoing charter management.

legal_citations.text: A material revision of the provisions of a charter may be made only with the approval of the chartering authority. A material revision shall be governed by the standards and criteria in Section 47605.

issues.required_language: Material revisions to charter provisions require Board approval and shall be evaluated using the same standards and criteria as initial charter petitions under Education Code 47605. The Superintendent or designee shall establish procedures for reviewing and processing material revision requests.

issues.title: Incomplete Reference to State Priorities
issues.description: The regulation references Education Code 52060 state priorities but doesn't specify all eight state priority areas, which could lead to incomplete charter petitions.

legal_citations.text: The state priorities shall be all of the following: (a) The degree to which pupils have access to, and are enrolled in, a broad course of study... [continues with 8 priority areas]

issues.required_language: Charter petitions shall address all applicable state priorities under Education Code 52060, including: basic services, implementation of state standards, parent involvement, student achievement, student engagement, school climate, course access, and other student outcomes.
